title: SYSTEM ONT CONFIGURATION COMMAND
description: This command is to configure the system wide ONT related parameters.
user_level:
The command can be accessed by operators with equipment privileges, and 
executed by operators with equipment privileges.
syntax: > configure generic-pon ont [ no slid-mode | slid-mode <Gpon::SlidMode> ] [ no sn-bundle-timer | sn-bundle-timer <Gpon::SnBundleTimer> ] [ no sw-ver-mis-block | sw-ver-mis-block <Gpon::SwVerMisBlock> ] [ no sn-autounlock | sn-autounlock <Gpon::OntAuthMode> ]

command_parameters.name: [no] slid-mode
command_parameters.description: display interpretation for gpon/ngpon2 subscriber location id optional parameter with default value: "ascii"
values: ascii                 : ascii interpretation for subscriber location
hexa-dec              : hexadecimal mode interpretation for subscriber location

command_parameters.name: [no] sn-bundle-timer
command_parameters.description: the system timer for bundling sn with loid/slid when gpon/ngpon2 ont is in auto-bundle mode optional parameter with default value: 24L - the system timer for auto bundling sn - unit: hour - range: [1...72]

command_parameters.name: [no] sw-ver-mis-block
command_parameters.description: the control behavior of user traffic block when for gpon/ngpon2 ont version mismatch optional parameter with default value: "enable"
values: enable                : block the user traffic when ont version mismatch
disable               : do not block the user traffic when ont version mismatch

command_parameters.name: [no] sn-autounlock
command_parameters.description: unlock ONT automatically after ONT authenticated optional parameter with default value: "disable"
values: disable               : disable unlock ONT automatically after ONT authenticated
enable                : enable unlock ONT automatically after ONT authenticated

raw:
help configure generic-pon ont
SYSTEM ONT CONFIGURATION COMMAND
================================

Command Description
-------------------

This command is to configure the system wide ONT related parameters.


User Level
----------

The command can be accessed by operators with equipment privileges, and 
executed by operators with equipment privileges.

Command Syntax
--------------

The command has the following syntax:
> configure generic-pon ont [ no slid-mode | slid-mode <Gpon::SlidMode> ] [ no 
sn-bundle-timer | sn-bundle-timer <Gpon::SnBundleTimer> ] [ no sw-ver-mis-block 
| sw-ver-mis-block <Gpon::SwVerMisBlock> ] [ no sn-autounlock | sn-autounlock 
<Gpon::OntAuthMode> ]

Command Parameters
------------------

Table "System ONT Configuration Command" Command Parameters

Parameter                  Description

[no] slid-mode             display interpretation for gpon/ngpon2 subscriber 
location id
                           optional parameter with default value: "ascii"

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::SlidMode>
                           Format:
                           ( ascii
                           | hexa-dec )
                           Possible values:
                           - ascii                 : ascii interpretation for 
subscriber location
                           - hexa-dec              : hexadecimal mode 
interpretation for subscriber location

[no] sn-bundle-timer       the system timer for bundling sn with loid/slid when 
gpon/ngpon2 ont is in auto-bundle mode

                           optional parameter with default value: 24L

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::SnBundleTimer>
                           Format:
                           - the system timer for auto bundling sn
                           - unit: hour
                           - range: [1...72]

[no] sw-ver-mis-block      the control behavior of user traffic block when for 
gpon/ngpon2 ont version mismatch
                           optional parameter with default value: "enable"

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::SwVerMisBlock>
                           Format:
                           ( enable
                           | disable )
                           Possible values:
                           - enable                : block the user traffic 
when ont version mismatch
                           - disable               : do not block the user 
traffic when ont version mismatch

[no] sn-autounlock          unlock ONT automatically after ONT authenticated
                           optional parameter with default value: "disable"

                           Parameter type: <Gpon::OntAuthMode>
                           Format:
                           ( disable
                           | enable )
                           Possible values:
                           - disable               : disable unlock ONT 
automatically after ONT authenticated
                           - enable                : enable unlock ONT 
automatically after ONT authenticated


DS-LIN-TEST-01:automationuser>#
